item.title: Seventy Thousand Degrees in a Water Glass
item.description:
They discovered it with sonar equipment in 1934. They said they had more important matters. They did.

There is a bubble of air at the center of a glass flask. Someone turns on a speaker. It expands â€” swells to fifty microns, about half the width of a human hair. Then the acoustic wave flips. The pressure outside reverses. The atmosphere decides it’s done being polite.

What happens next takes less than a nanosecond.
